definitions.text: a transient variation in voltage or current
sports equipment consisting of a sharp point on the sole of a shoe worn by athletes
fruiting spike of a cereal plant especially corn
(botany) an indeterminate inflorescence bearing sessile flowers on an unbranched axis
a sharp rise followed by a sharp decline
examples: the seismograph showed a sharp spike in response to the temblor

definitions.text: a very high narrow heel on women's shoes
each of the sharp points on the soles of athletic shoes to prevent slipping (or the shoes themselves)
examples: the second baseman sharpened his spikes before every game
golfers' spikes damage the putting greens

definitions.text: a sharp-pointed projection along the top of a fence or wall (or a dinosaur)
a long, thin sharp-pointed implement (wood or metal)
examples: one of the spikes impaled him

definitions.text: any holding device consisting of a rigid, sharp-pointed object
examples: the spike pierced the receipts and held them in order
they used spikes to fasten the rails to a railroad tie

definitions.text: pierce with a sharp stake or point
examples: impale a shrimp on a skewer

definitions.text: bring forth a spike or spikes
examples: my hyacinths and orchids are spiking now
